items.title: Dancing Naked on the Head of a Pin: The Early History of Microphotography
items.excerpt: In 1853, John Benjamin Dancer achieved a feat of seemingly impossible scale: he shrunk an image to the size of a sharpened pencil tip. Anika Burgess explores the invention of microphotography and its influence on erotic paraphernalia and military communications.
